The 'List of leading Thoroughbred racehorses' contains the names of undefeated
racehorses or those horses which had a very impressive racing record. The great
racehorses of over two centuries have been able to capture the publicâs
imagination because they could outrace their peers in a number of major races or
in long consecutive winning sequences.

Ever since English Thoroughbreds commenced racing, the aim was to find the
fastest and best of them all. Centuries later, and after many great racehorses
have passed on debates continue as to which were the leading racehorses. A good
consistent racehorse, typically requires ability, stamina or speed in varying
degrees, to defeat their contemporaries. However time tests are unreliable as a
good basis for comparisons between horses of different eras. Time variations may
occur as a result of using hand-operated stop-watches, track conditions and wind
direction etc. which make timing an unreliable judging criterion.

The two main forms of Thoroughbred horseracing are flat racing, and hurdle or
steeplechase (jumping) races over obstacles.

Winning all three of the two-year-old, or three-year-old Triple Crown races
though is a rare achievement and is considered one of the greatest
accomplishments of a Thoroughbred racehorse. Below are listed most of the
leading horses of the worldâs racecourses for over two centuries.
headings: Horses that have won more than $10 million
